verses.kjv: Then Naomi her mother in law said unto her, My daughter, shall I not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee?
verses.ct: Naomi, her mother-in-law, said to her, "My daughter, shouldn't I try to find a secure home for you so that things will go well for you?"

verses.kjv: And now is not Boaz of our kindred, with whose maidens thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.
verses.ct: "Now, isn't Boaz one of our relatives — the one whose young women you've been working alongside? Listen, tonight he'll be winnowing barley at the threshing floor."

verses.kjv: Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto the man, until he shall have done eating and drinking.
verses.ct: "So bathe yourself, put on some perfume, get dressed in your best clothing, and go down to the threshing floor. But don't let him know you're there until he has finished eating and drinking."

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark the place where he shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncover his feet, and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do.
verses.ct: "When he lies down, pay attention to where he settles. Then go over, uncover his feet, and lie down there. He will tell you what to do next."

verses.kjv: And she said unto her, All that thou sayest unto me I will do.
verses.ct: Ruth replied, "I'll do everything you've told me."

verses.kjv: And she went down unto the floor, and did according to all that her mother in law bade her.
verses.ct: So she went down to the threshing floor and followed all of her mother-in-law's instructions.

verses.kjv: And when Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softly, and uncovered his feet, and laid her down.
verses.ct: After Boaz had eaten and drunk and was feeling content, he went to lie down at the far end of the grain pile. Ruth quietly approached, uncovered his feet, and lay down.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at midnight, that the man was afraid, and turned himself: and, behold, a woman lay at his feet.
verses.ct: In the middle of the night, the man was startled and rolled over — and there was a woman lying at his feet.

verses.kjv: And he said, Who art thou? And she answered, I am Ruth thine handmaid: spread therefore thy skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art a near kinsman.
verses.ct: "Who are you?" he asked. She answered, "I am Ruth, your servant. Spread the corner of your garment over me, because you are a close relative who can redeem our family."

verses.kjv: And he said, Blessed be thou of the LORD, my daughter: for thou hast shewed more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, inasmuch as thou followedst not young men, whether poor or rich.
verses.ct: He said, "May the LORD bless you, my daughter. This act of loyalty is even greater than what you showed before, since you didn't go after younger men, whether poor or wealthy."

verses.kjv: And now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou requirest: for all the city of my people doth know that thou art a virtuous woman.
verses.ct: "So now, my daughter, don't worry. I will do everything you ask. Everyone in our town knows that you are a woman of noble character."

verses.kjv: And now it is true that I am thy near kinsman: howbeit there is a kinsman nearer than I.
verses.ct: "It's true that I am a close relative with the right to redeem. However, there is another relative who is even closer than I am."

verses.kjv: Tarry this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the kinsman’s part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee, as the LORD liveth: lie down until the morning.
verses.ct: "Stay here tonight. In the morning, if he is willing to fulfill the redeemer's responsibility for you, good — let him do it. But if he is not willing, then as surely as the LORD lives, I will do it myself. Lie down until morning."

verses.kjv: And she lay at his feet until the morning: and she rose up before one could know another. And he said, Let it not be known that a woman came into the floor.
verses.ct: She lay at his feet until morning but got up before it was light enough for anyone to recognize each other. Boaz said, "No one should know that a woman came to the threshing floor."

verses.kjv: Also he said, Bring the vail that thou hast upon thee, and hold it. And when she held it, he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her: and she went into the city.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Hold out the shawl you're wearing and keep it open." When she did, he measured out 6 portions of barley and placed it on her. Then she headed back to the city.

verses.kjv: And when she came to her mother in law, she said, Who art thou, my daughter? And she told her all that the man had done to her.
verses.ct: When she arrived home, her mother-in-law asked, "How did it go, my daughter?" Ruth told her everything the man had done for her.

verses.kjv: And she said, These six measures of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.
verses.ct: She said, "He gave me these 6 portions of barley, because he told me, 'Don't go back to your mother-in-law with nothing.'"

verses.kjv: Then said she, Sit still, my daughter, until thou know how the matter will fall: for the man will not be in rest, until he have finished the thing this day.
verses.ct: Naomi said, "Wait patiently, my daughter, until you find out how this turns out. That man will not rest until he has settled this matter today."
